SAMPLE NOTES
TOPIC: characteristics of various kinds of forest fires
surface fire:
burns on surface of forest
moves slowly and remains low to ground
crown fire:
burns in tops of trees
moves quickly from treetop to treetop
can cause a lot of property damage
ground fire:
burns below forest floor
is usually caused by lightning
is slow-moving and lasts for a long time
can be difficult to detect
can kill trees by burning their roots
